Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic and the Denver Nuggets mounted a fourth-quarter comeback to wipe out Minnesota’s 16-point lead and establish a 10-point advantage but ultimately lost 119-116 after surrendering a 10-0 run to close out the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Timberwolves, who knocked the Nuggets out of last season's playoffs, traded Karl-Anthony Towns and brought in Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo.
Michael Porter Jr. acknowledged the possibility that the team could be broken up if they continue to struggle this year.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic’s teammate, Michael Porter Jr., said, 'If we don't win it this year, we all know they might have to break it up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nikola Jokic led the Nuggets with 26 points, 13 assists, and 9 rebounds.
Aaron Gordon led the Nuggets with 31 points and 11 rebounds.
Anthony Edwards topped the Timberwolves with 29 points.
Rudy Gobert recorded 17 points and 14 rebounds.
Julius Randle chipped in with 23 points, seven assists, and six rebounds.
Others: The Nuggets have had trouble recapturing their on-court brilliance since their championship victory in 2023.
The team ranks third-worst in bench scoring, contributing only 22.5 ppg while shooting a league-low 32.6%.
